DOC.brief_summary: A randomized screening trial compare diagnostic accuracy screen breast cancer three-dimensional digital breast tomosynthesis ( DBT ) plus two-dimensional full-field digital mammography ( FFDM ) versus FFDM alone .
DOC.detailed_description: The Tomosynthesis Mammography Imaging Screening Trial ( TMIST ) LEAD-IN conducted ensure Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group / American College Radiology Imaging Network ( ECOG/ACRIN ) TMIST component properly functional provide opportunity fine tune launch full TMIST . The accrual target TMIST LEAD-IN 6354 participant ( one tenth project enrollment target TMIST ) three lead-in study site : 1 . Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre Toronto , 2 . Vancouver ( auspex Screening Mammography Programme British Columbia ) 3 . The Ottawa Hospital .
DOC.criteria: Asymptomatic woman age 40 Scheduled screen mammogram Able tolerate digital breast tomosynthesis fullfield digital mammographic imaging require protocol Willing able provide write informed consent . Presenting mammography symptom breast disease Have new breast complaint ( e.g . lump , nipple discharge ) Have mammogram breast within last 11 month Previous personal history breast cancer Has breast enhancement ( e.g . implant injection ) Pregnancy intent become pregnant .
